docs.lead_paragraph: With Congress returning next week, the calendar for confirmation hearings on nominees to President-elect Barack Obama's Cabinet is becoming more crowded by the day. If anything, the slate of hearings so far seems to be near the pace set for the Bush administration's nominees.

headline.main: Cabinet Confirmation Hearings Start Next Week

docs.abstract: Worth watching: The lineup for Senate confirmation hearings of Obama's nominees firms up even more, and begins within a week.
docs.snippet: Worth watching: The lineup for Senate confirmation hearings of Obama's nominees firms up even more, and begins within a week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Part two of a three-part series on home health aides, to be published on Tuesdays in The New Old Age.

headline.main: Home Health Aides: What They Make, What They Cost

docs.abstract: Marki Flannery of Partners in Care answer questions about the costs of home health aides, the intimate strangers who often make it possible for our parents to remain in their homes.
docs.snippet: Marki Flannery of Partners in Care answer questions about the costs of home health aides, the intimate strangers who often make it possible for our parents to remain in their homes.

docs.lead_paragraph: The proposed deal is unusual because it is one of the first transactions involving unregulated private equity firms acquiring a majority stake in a bank holding company.
